abstract: Many members of lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender community express distrust of New York Police Dept, despite decades of change and current promises that 2016 Gay Pride parade will be heavily guarded in wake of Orlando shootings; while police dept has many LGBT officers serving openly, activists says large portion of their community continues to be marginalized and disrespected.

headline.print_headline: As Police Hoist Rainbow Banner for Parade,  Gay New Yorkers Weigh Pride and Prejudice
headline.main: In New York, Gay Marchers Weigh Pride, Prejudice and the Police

snippet: Plans for a heightened police presence at the pride parade, amplified by the mass killings in Orlando, Fla., have highlighted a rift over the very definition of “security.”
lead_paragraph: Plans for a heightened police presence at the pride parade, amplified by the mass killings in Orlando, Fla., have highlighted a rift over the very definition of “security.”
